title: Jantzen Derrick
text:
Jantzen Stuart Derrick (born 10 January 1943) is an English former professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> and <a href="winger%20%28association%20football%29">winger</a>.
Career.
Derrick started his career with <a href="Bristol%20City%20F.C.">Bristol City</a>, playing 259 matches and scoring 31 goals. He spent the 1970–71 season on loan to <a href="Mansfield%20Town%20F.C.">Mansfield Town</a>. In 1971, Derrick joined <a href="Paris%20Saint-Germain%20F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a>; he would go on to play three matches for them before heading to <a href="Bath%20City%20F.C.">Bath City</a>, where he would put an end to his career in 1975.
Personal life.
Jantzen Derrick was born in <a href="Bristol">Bristol</a> on 10 January 1943.
Later in his life, he would work as a <a href="van">van</a> vendor in Bristol.
